00018 // InstantIFMechConfig class definition

00022         : public ConfigBase

00024 public:
00026

00030 
00032     MAKE_VISITABLE(InstantIFMechConfig)
00033 
00034 public:
00035 //  InstantIFMechConfig(double tauP, double Vth, double Vr, double Vp);

00058 
00060 // InstantIFMech definition
00061 // models an integrate-&-fire neuron
00063 
00064 class InstantIFMech
00065 {
00066 protected:
00067     explicit InstantIFMech(ConfigBase * const configurator);
00068     template <class TypeImpl> void perform_calculations(TypeImpl & neuron);
00069     const Volt & potential_impl() const {
00070         return v[1];
00071     }
00072 private:
00073     const InstantIFMechConfig * const ifmcfg_;
00074     double v[2];  // membrane potential at consecutive time steps (mV)
00075     double alpha[2], beta[2]; // Array of working variables.  See Shelly&Tao. ( s^-1, mV/s)
00076 //  double * alphasyn, * betasyn; // Array of working variables recording k for each presynpase so this doesn't need to be recalculated.
00077     double k[2]; // Array of working variable. See Shelly&Tao. (mV/s)
00078 };
00079 
00080 
00081 
00083 // inline definitions
00085 
00087 // constructor
00088 inline InstantIFMech::InstantIFMech(ConfigBase * const configurator)
00089         : ifmcfg_(dynamic_cast<InstantIFMechConfig *>(configurator))
00090 {
00091     if (! ifmcfg_) throw ConfigError("InstantIFMech: void configurator");
00092 
00093 //  v[0] = v[1] = ifmcfg_->Vr();
00094     // new way to initialize v:
00095     do
00096         v[0] = v[1] = ifmcfg_->V_init_distrib_->generate_value();
00097     while ((v[0] < ifmcfg_->Vr()) || (v[0] > ifmcfg_->Vth()));
00098     // warning: this would be an infinite loop if one chose a V_init_distrib that
00099     // only generated values outside of (Vr,Vth).
00100     // should throw a ConfigError if this is the case
00101 
00102     alpha[0] = alpha[1] = 1.0 / ifmcfg_->tauP();
00103     beta[0] = beta[1] = ifmcfg_->Vp() / ifmcfg_->tauP();
00104     k[0] = k[1] = 0;
00105 }
00106 
00108 // mechanism called to update the state of the neuron
00109 template <class TypeImpl>
00110 inline void InstantIFMech::perform_calculations(TypeImpl & neuron)
00111 {
00112     // Update v;
00113     v[0] = v[1];
00114 
00115     // sum all synaptic contributions (continuous or impulsive conductance and current):
00116     for (typename TypeImpl::ListSynMechType::const_iterator i = neuron.presynmechlist_impl().begin();
00117             i != neuron.presynmechlist_impl().end();
00118             ++i)
00119         (*i)->send_updated_states(alpha[1], beta[1]);
00120 
00121     // increment v[0] with the net impulsive current
00122     v[0] += beta[1] - alpha[1] * v[0];
00123     alpha[1] = 0.0;    // re-initialise (note, only alpha[1] and beta[1] are used in instantaneous version)
00124     beta[1] = 0.0;
00125 
00126     if (v[0] > ifmcfg_->Vth()) { // the neuron spikes!
00127         // spike occurs at the *beginning* of the timestep:
00128         v[0] = ifmcfg_->Vr();
00129 
00130         // effect the consequences of the spike: time until the spike from the current simulation time
00131         neuron.notify_firing_impl(0);
00132     }
00133 
00134     // Passive evolution from t0 to t1:
00135     v[1] = ifmcfg_->Vp() + ifmcfg_->Vfactor() * (v[0] - ifmcfg_->Vp());
00136 }
